body:
This PR provides a clean and maintainable fix for [#3600](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/3600), improving how `doc/configs.txt` is generated for use in `:help`.

### What's changed

- Reworked `scripts/docgen.lua` to properly generate `configs.txt` with helptag-compatible formatting
- Uses `scripts/docs_template.txt` as a dedicated template for Vim help output
- Avoids injecting `*tags*` and `========` into Markdown output (`configs.md`), ensuring clarity in both formats

### Background

Previously, I submitted a patch that directly edited `configs.txt` (#3674). After I fixes it by enhancing the docgen logic instead of editing the output manually.

I'd be happy to get some feedback.

comment_data.body:
- help files put the line before the text, reverse of markdown.
- add a blank line after the title

```suggestion
==============================================================================
{{tagline}}

```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -48,17 +49,25 @@ local function make_parts(fns)
 end
 
 local function make_section(indentlvl, sep, parts)
-  return indent(indentlvl, table.concat(make_parts(parts), sep))
+  local flat = make_parts(parts)
+  if not flat or #flat == 0 then
+    return ''
+  end
+  return indent(indentlvl, table.concat(flat, sep))
 end
 
 local function readfile(path)
   assert((vim.loop.fs_stat(path) or {}).type == 'file')
   return io.open(path):read '*a'
 end
 
-local lsp_section_template = [[
-## {{config_name}}
+local function relpath(from, to)
+  return to:gsub('^' .. vim.pesc(from) .. '/', '')
+end
 
+local lsp_section_template_txt = [[
+{{tagline}}
+==============================================================================

Type |gO| to see the table of contents.

comment_data.body: Let's drop this for help files. `gO` does this automatically.

@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@

+Type |g0| to see the table of contents.
+Press |K| on a heptag to jump to its documentation.
+
+==============================================================================
+Implemented servers:

+{{implemented_servers_list}}

comment_data.body: revert. this ToC is only needed for markdown. don't need it in help files.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,29 +291,32 @@ local function make_implemented_servers_list()
     0,
     '\n',
     map_sorted(configs, function(k)
-      return template('- [{{server}}](#{{server}})', { server = k })
+      return string.format('- |%s|', k)

comment_data.body:
revert. this vim.validate() signature is deprecated.

if the other signature was failing for you, update to Nvim 0.11
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -263,29 +291,32 @@ local function make_implemented_servers_list()
     0,
     '\n',
     map_sorted(configs, function(k)
-      return template('- [{{server}}](#{{server}})', { server = k })
+      return string.format('- |%s|', k)
     end)
   )
 end
 
-local function generate_readme(template_file, params)
-  vim.validate('lsp_server_details', params.lsp_server_details, 'string')
-  vim.validate('implemented_servers_list', params.implemented_servers_list, 'string')
+local function generate_readme(template_file, params, output_file)
+  vim.validate({
+    lsp_server_details = { params.lsp_server_details, 'string' },
+    implemented_servers_list = { params.implemented_servers_list, 'string' },
+  })

comment_data.body: what's wrong with vim.fs.relpath? Note, it requires Nvim 0.11
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,7 +173,7 @@ local function make_lsp_sections()
                 end
               end
               io.close(file)
-              local config_relpath = vim.fs.relpath(root, config_file)
+              local config_relpath = relpath(root, config_file)

comment_data.body: The `Type |gO| to see the table of contents.` should be included, same as all builtin help files. `gO` is not as well-known as `K` or `<c-]>`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+*lspconfig-all*                              *lspconfig-server-configurations*
+
+LSP configurations provided by nvim-lspconfig are listed below.
+

comment_data.body:
If we're going to add tags for every single config, they should have a common prefix like `lspconfig-`. But I think we should not do this for now. It adds 1000s of tags, most of which no one really needs, and pollutes the `:help` auto-completion.

To find a config, users can just do `:help lspconfig-all` and then use `/` to search. That's completely reasonable.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -104,6 +130,8 @@ local function make_lsp_sections()
         preamble = '',
         commands = '',
         default_values = '',
+        tagline = is_markdown and ''
+          or string.format('%s                                                       *%s*', config_name, config_name),

comment_data.body: would prefer to minimize the differences between txt vs md. the only real difference is the title. don't need bold here or above.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,9 @@
+*lspconfig-all*                              *lspconfig-server-configurations*
+
+LSP configurations provided by nvim-lspconfig are listed below.
+
+==============================================================================

comment_regular_data.body: At a glance, this looks good 👍

Thanks for the review!
You're absolutely right — that change was inappropriate, so I've reverted it.
I'll do the remaining changes myself. Thanks for the help!

Thank you so much for taking the time to review and guide me through the PR – I really appreciate your detailed feedback and patience. I’m sorry it took quite a few rounds to get things right.

I’ve realized how much I still have to learn about Lua and vimdoc, but I’m motivated to keep improving and hope to contribute more actively to Neovim in the future.

Thanks again for all your support!

title: fix(docgen): regenerate configs.txt with correct :help format
